intro: Robiquetia vietnamensis subsp. minima, commonly known as the Vietnamese minuta, is a rare and small shrub native to Vietnam. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit, narrow leaves, and small, white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in shaded, moist environments, typically in tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
